summary: The 'Extraordinary Measures Transparency Act' requires the Secretary of the Treasury to report to Congress on actions taken to avoid breaching the debt limit. This includes reports 30 days before reaching the limit (detailing intended measures and costs), daily reports while using extraordinary measures (listing actions and transfers), and a final report after the measures are no longer in use (summarizing measures and administrative costs). The bill defines 'extraordinary measures', 'administrative cost', and 'debt limit'.
